xxl.io
Class RandomAccessFileQueue

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.io.StreamQueue
              |
              +--xxl.io.RandomAccessFileQueue
public class RandomAccessFileQueue
extends StreamQueue
implements FIFOQueue

This class provides a stream queue that stores the bytes of its serialized elements in a random access file. Neither the peek method nor the remove method are implemented by this queue queue. A converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

Example usage (1). 

     // create a new file

     File file = new File("queue.dat");

     // create a new random access file queue with ...

     RandomAccessFileQueue queue = new RandomAccessFileQueue(

         // the created file

         file,

         // an integer converter

         IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE,

         // an input buffer size of 4 bytes

         new Constant(4),

         // an output buffer size of 4 bytes

         new Constant(4)
     );

     // insert the integers from 0 to 9 into the queue

     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
         queue.insert(new Integer(i));

     // print 5 elements of the queue

     int i = 0;
     while (i < 5 && queue.hasNext()) {
         i = ((Integer)queue.next()).intValue();
         System.out.println(i);
     }

     // insert the integers from 20 to 29 into the queue

     for (i = 20; i < 30; i++)
         queue.insert(new Integer(i));

     // print all elements of the queue

     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());

     // close and clear the queue after use

     queue.close();
     queue.clear();

See Also:
Constant, FIFOQueue, File, Function, InputStream, IOException, Iterator, OutputStream, RandomAccessFile, WrappingRuntimeException

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new RandomAccessFileQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). In contradiction to the contract in Queue it may only be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of objects. The array (parameter list) will be used for initializing the random access file queue by calling the constructor RandomAccessFileQueue((File) array[0], (Function) array[1], new Constant(0), new Constant(0)).
See Also:
Function

file

protected File file
The file is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.

randomAccessFile

protected RandomAccessFile randomAccessFile
A random access file stream for reading from and writing to file. The stream is created by invoking openFile with file when the file stack queue is opened.

openFile

protected Function openFile
A function that implements the functionality of opening the file for random access. The function is invoked with file when this file stack queue is opened and must implement all the functionality that is needed to open a file for random access. When being invoked the function must retrun a RandomAccessFile. The function determines whether the queue uses objects that are stored in the file before calling a constructor of RandomAccessFileQueue as initial elements of the queue. E.g. when setting the length of the RandomAccessFile to 0 before returning it, objects that are stored in the file are removed.

readOffset

protected long readOffset
The offset from the beginning of the file, in bytes, at which the next serialized element of this queue is stored.
Constructor Detail

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(File file,
                             Converter converter,
                             Function inputBufferSize,
                             Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new random access file that store its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
Parameters:
file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(File file,
                             Converter converter,
                             Function inputBufferSize,
                             Function outputBufferSize,
                             Iterator iterator)
Constructs a new random access file queue containing the elements of the specified iterator, that store its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
Parameters:
file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
iterator - the iterator whose elements are to be inserted into this queue.

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(File file,
                             Function openFile,
                             Converter converter,
                             Function inputBufferSize,
                             Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new random access file queue that store its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the function openFile is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access. Whether objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue or not depends on openFile. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
Parameters:
file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
openFile - a function that is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(File file,
                             Function openFile,
                             Converter converter,
                             Function inputBufferSize,
                             Function outputBufferSize,
                             Iterator iterator)
Constructs a new random access file queue containing the elements of the specified iterator, that store its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the function openFile is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access. Whether objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue or not depends on openFile. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(File file,
                             Converter converter,
                             Function newObject,
                             Function inputBufferSize,
                             Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new random access file queue that store its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
Parameters:
file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

Method Detail

open

protected void open()
             throws IOException
Opens the random access file queue for the access to elements of this queue. This method is called implicitly every time the inputStream or outputStream method is called. This implementation checks whether a random access file stream already exists. When no such stream exists, openFile is invoked with file and the elements that are stored in the file after opening it for random access are used as initial elements of the queue.

inputStream

protected InputStream inputStream()
                           throws IOException
Opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue and returns it.
This implementation opens the random access file queue first. Thereafter the file pointer of the random access file is set to readOffset and an input stream is returned, that redirects every calls to one of its methods to the corresponding method of the random access file.
Overrides:
inputStream in class StreamQueue
Returns:
an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue.

outputStream

protected OutputStream outputStream()
                             throws IOException
Opens an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue and returns it.
This implementation opens the random access file queue first. Thereafter the file pointer of the random access file is set to its end and an output stream is returned, that redirects every calls to one of its methods to the corresponding method of the random access file.
Overrides:
outputStream in class StreamQueue
Returns:
an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
This implementation simply closes the queue, deletes the internally used file and sets size to 0.
Overrides:
clear in class StreamQueue

close

public void close()
Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
This implementation closes the random access file and deletes the file, when it is empty. Therefore the file stack queue can be reopened later and will have the same state as before closing it, when openFile does not affect the elements stored in the file.
Overrides:
close in class StreamQueue

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a RandomAccessFileQueue. It can also be used to test the functionality of a RandomAccessFileQueue.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
